intro: Crypsinus caudifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved crypts, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Crypsinus caudifolius is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
